website_summaries.verdict: From slaying dragons, playing princess, or rescuing damsels in distress, this play tent encourages healthy imaginative play.
pros: Both boys and girls love the castle design
Large enough for friends and parents
Two windows extend play options with outside interaction and allow air to circulate
cons: While setup is still fairly easy, it's not a pop-up tent and requires pole assembly

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏽
customer_reviews.text: Was a little tricky to put together because there's only a small diagram on the case and no written instructions, But all in all the castle is great. Hasn't fallen down yet even with my 4yo shaking it around. Don't think the material is worth 20$ but we'll see how long it lasts. The bottom is very thin so make sure you get pillows or a dog bed if you have wood floors. Picture next to a 5'11 tree for size reference.
customer_reviews.author: ElenaMarie Williams

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper!
customer_reviews.text: Love this, it's bigger than I expected Me and my one year old fit in it perfectly Still a bit dark in there for reading, so I'll have to attach a hanging light But what tent isn't dark, right? Lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful quality.
customer_reviews.text: During the initial building of this thing, the top ripped open exposing the sticks that hold it up. On top of that, the strings to hold them to the side wall tore out immediately. Looks elsewhere because this thing is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Claxen

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy again
customer_reviews.text: I had already ordered a princess one and it's very durable, I received it four days before I got this one for my son. I ordered them at the same time. Setting it up was easily and seemed durable but immediately one of the ties for the rod broke off so I sewed it back on. The next day three out of the four seams on the bottom where the rods go we're ripping and popping out! And a rod broke. Very disappointing to wait four extra days for such a poor quality made item. And then shipping it back was way more than it's worth. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: not happy
customer_reviews.text: One of the straps that holds the legs broke the first time I used this product. Because this tie strap broke, the castle does not function properly. I am hoping that the company will see this review and offer to exchange or replace this product.
customer_reviews.author: jolin

customer_reviews.title: Great toy but very poor construction
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this thing, and for the price, I couldn't give it 1-star. However, the construction of this tent is abysmal. While setting it up, one of the strings that holds a pole in place tore the seam. About two days later, another string tore away the seam. Now, the seam around the doorway is starting to tear. It would still be a tremendous deal for this tent to have to spend another 10 to 15 dollars if that meant double-stitched seams. I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: inIA62607

customer_reviews.title: Pretty happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 1 and 2 year old dogs for Christmas, and, let's be real, I honestly didn't expect this to last very long. Turns out they love it and play in it all the time. My 2 year old dog is always laying inside with his head poking out of the doorway, and last night, my 1 year old pup even slept in it instead of with me on the bed! They both play rough and it's been holding up pretty well so far, despite all the beatings it's taking.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It was super easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 3 year old Tasmanian devil a few months back. It was super easy to put together. It went up in like a minute or two. It looked good and had plenty of space. But it didn't last much longer than it took to put up. Unless you are just going to sit there. This won't last long. My son is rough with stuff but the seems nearly bust when you put it together. But for 20 bucks we were able to make it work for a few weeks with Duct tape. It's not bad. Kind of what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: CAMERON

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a toddler who wants their own castle
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old son loves this! It was pretty easy to set up. If you've set up a tent before you'll be able to set this up. It's not the highest quality, but I knew that purchasing it, I purchased for the price. While it's the perfect size for a toddler, don't expect to go in their with him. I'm 6'0" 185# and can barely get my shoulders through the door, let alone maneuver inside; however, it is tall enough for me to sit in, which I did once.
customer_reviews.author: dkdenergy

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Well it lasted less than a month. The top parts started to come thru which caused the castle to sway & look like it was sagging. I guess it worked for when it worked. It was cheap so I suppose not too bad but a month?? And today is 6/20 & I missed the window to exchange it 6/17 #bummer
customer_reviews.author: Frazn

customer_reviews.title: Not the actual item pictured
customer_reviews.text: Tent was a nice tent but in the photos for the item it CLEARLY has a lip or something at the base of the door, this is NOT the actual product and the lip was the reason I got it as my sons ball pit was destroyed and we needed another asap.....I was very disapointed. The item pictured should be the item sent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old loves it! It’s pretty big he loves going in there and coloring or just passing time playing with his tablet or toys. He has spent most of the quartering playing in there. I recommend getting one
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: This castle is such a great buy. I have seen them in stores that are 30 dollars more expensive for the same thing. It was very easy to put together, took less than 5 minutes. It is large, my son and I can both fit into it comfortably and read stories. We love it! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Taija

customer_reviews.title: Cool tent
customer_reviews.text: Flaps don’t stay up, and the whole reason I got this one vs something similar was because the picture showed a little lip that doesn’t exist on the tent. I got it make a ball pit, and had to buy a pool noodle. Otherwise it’s a great play tent, dogs and kids like it, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole M Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Ties break
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his castle. We’ve had it for some time now. The problem I have with it is that one of the ties that keeps one of the poles in place broke so now it won’t stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Frances C.

customer_reviews.title: Fun hideaway!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my best friend's two boys, who are 2 and 4 years old. They absolutely love it. My friend said the setup was easy and they love spending time in it!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie McWilliams

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but Strange Set Up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew to play in. It's fun, but the set up is a little weird. The poles are on the inside of the tent and can be tricky to set up. It also falls over super easily. He's 1 1/2 years old and when he lays down the whole thing goes with him. He loved it, though.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: The door was already starting to rip off when we ...
customer_reviews.text: The door was already starting to rip off when we opened the box and and one of the ties to hold the tent poles in place was missing. I tried to set it up anyway and it was a huge pain to set up. Unfortunately I missed the window to return it, so now it's going in the trash. Do not buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been begging us for a tent for a while and we finally have the room for one. It looks just like the photos and my daughter adores it. She’ll want to go to bed in it and has made it her own little fort. It was perfect
customer_reviews.author: Izza

customer_reviews.title: low quality
customer_reviews.text: Son loves it but the quality is not so great. One of the slot for the poles tore apart and the velcro to keep the door shut tore off. The castle roof bricks doesn't stay up. It gets hot in the tent. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: let me tell U

customer_reviews.title: Lots of moving room
customer_reviews.text: My glam pup has a wide behind and couldn’t fit in the normal size dog tents , so I got her this. She loves her castle. Plenty of room for her to move around in. She is truly the queen of her own castle.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Horrible came with a huge hole on top. Waited so long for it to arrive only to have to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy, easy to tear but otherwise nice cheap tent
customer_reviews.text: Arrived torn and not due to delivery process. Tear visible in top of tent before I ever set it up. Cheap product, my son will enjoy it hopefully longer than I expect. Playtime will definitely damage it if there is any tugging or pressure on sides which will of course happen with my toddler. Otherwise looks as pictured, my son likes it. At least it didn't cost much. I sewed the corner myself, the shipping back and complaining process isn't worth the time and fuss to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy used
customer_reviews.text: They said there were some cosmetic issues but when arrived there were 2 holes ( I was ok with those) but when I put it together there was a pole missing so it’s useless. It would be fun if the tent could stay up.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole M Wunderle

customer_reviews.title: I had them all assembled side by side (looked like tent city lol) and each kid quietly sat in ...
customer_reviews.text: Gave these (different styles) out to all the kids in the fam for XMas and was a immediately huge hit! I had them all assembled side by side (looked like tent city lol) and each kid quietly sat in their forts and did their thing. Sometimes visited their neighbors. It's cute.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: The ties to keep the poles up in the inside break off easily. We had to throw the tent away after only 2 weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Snedeker

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. I bought this for my daughters birthday
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. I bought this for my daughters birthday. Within threes hours of setting it up, it already had a large hole in it along the seam connecting the base to the tent structure, and that was before she even played with it. The next morning, I went to look at it and there poles holding the tent up had poked through the base straps. A kids toy should really last more than 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: James Neely

customer_reviews.title: Cute but won't last long
customer_reviews.text: It's a cute tent....but made from a cheap and thin material. The roof had tears in it when I first took it out of the package. The picture looks like it has a lip on the opening, but it's flat in the entry way.
customer_reviews.author: C. Marsili

customer_reviews.title: Not just for kids
customer_reviews.text: We use this tent for a indoor dog retreat for our mid size dog. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Chelle Ann

customer_reviews.title: Adorable Play Castle For My Toddler
customer_reviews.text: Thin material and metal posts can easily be broken just trying to construct this tent, but we got it together and my son plays in it daily. For $20, it's a good find and I'm glad I bought it for him. It's an adorable little tent.
customer_reviews.author: Sarafina Donald

customer_reviews.title: Every Kiddo Needs One of These
customer_reviews.text: Every little kid needs a fortress to hide in. My son loves this, and I can see him loving it more and more as he gets a little older (he is only one). We play hide and seek in it, we read books in it--he laughs so hard when I get in it with him and he loves the windows. I think it is a great bargain for the price, and I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mhh

customer_reviews.title: Cute Cute Cute!
customer_reviews.text: Cute! I think it is used now for "toy storage" than actual play but it's nice for that. So far my granddaughter has had it for 3 months and it has held up well...I like the "real" castle look...
customer_reviews.author: clark

customer_reviews.title: Every girl needs a castle!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly took less than ten minutes, the two windows are cute. It’s a great size, the stitching is good enough for gentle use but probably will not last my little monster’s destructive ways. My daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.author: mark montez

customer_reviews.title: Not for children over 3
customer_reviews.text: This tent is not for children older than 3. My son took it apart. The tent is not sturdy at all. With the exposed poles, it's easy for a child to take it apart. There are better popup houses that simple pop up, and do not require any type of assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to go wrong for $20
customer_reviews.text: Was gonna spend a ton of $$$ on comforters and sheets to make a fort for my son when we watch movies. This is $20 and not hard to assemble. I don't fit in it with him (I couldn't by myself anyways) but we can still hang out close to the entrance. It's not quick enough to assemble that I take it apart so it spends time in between our living room and his bedroom. Some have complained that the poles aren't great but my son is a brute and he shares it with our 75lb black lab so I'm not sure what other are doing to break them. It's $20. You'd be crazy not to grab one.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: good luck! You have to crawl into the tent ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this tent. But setting it up was difficult. If you are not flexible or if average weight, good luck! You have to crawl into the tent to set it up. And I have had to re sew the ties that hold the poles up three times now. But in the end my son does love this tent and don’t regret buying it because the size is great. He has his chair in it and plays on his tablet in it. It’s a good hideout for him
customer_reviews.author: Meredith De Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Great Hagrid’s Hut
customer_reviews.text: Castle? Or Hagrid’s hut? My Harry Potter loving nephew loves his Hagrid’s Hut!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rips easily
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tent for Christmas and I was so excited because my kids were going to love it and it was so cute but within a month, the little pocket that holds the support sticks ripped so the castle won’t stand up anymore :( I had to throw it away, my kids were super sad.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Resendez

customer_reviews.title: well it was fun...
customer_reviews.text: Fun while it lasted. Was annihilated and collapsed within 6 hours of kids getting in and out. Now one's trying to sell their Christmas chocolate in order to raise money to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: tent
customer_reviews.text: my grandson loves his castle. Its very easy to put up and take down. It is much bigger than i anticipated. Plenty of room for a friend to play along.It has a nice flooring, made out of the same thin material. My grandson is 3 and has played with his quite a bit, no rips or tears so far, so its holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Charleen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the buy.
customer_reviews.text: The quality is crappy and they made it to where the posts are tied on the inside which doesn't make much since because what toddler isn't going to want to pull on those ties or posts? All the post ties were pulled off so now the posts don't stand up making it completely useless. The product just wasn't well engineered.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Robles

customer_reviews.title: Already got a hole
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it but it already got a hole!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My son loved it so much
customer_reviews.text: My son loved it so much. Purchased one for his cousin and one for his friend. Going on a year and still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: MPBF2011

customer_reviews.title: Big, no lip at the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for ball pit balls because of the lip at the bottom, it doesn't actually have that. Other than that it's amazing quality and goes up easily. It is pretty big
customer_reviews.author: Allisenbr46

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: My kids love it, it’s easy to assemble and disassemble. Well made
customer_reviews.author: leticia

customer_reviews.title: Great for little ones
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a year and so far no rips or tares.
customer_reviews.author: Bmoney2021

customer_reviews.title: Kids use imagination and play for hours!
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to set up and take down. Folds up nicely and easy to store when done!
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Better quality than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our one year old and he loves it. Better quality than I expected. Fairly easy set up with picture instructions. Nice red color and carrying case for storage. There is no lip but we still put the ball pit balls inside, they just easily slip out.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: A Must Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a go to gift for us now. Everyone we have purchased this for LOVES it. Super easy to put together and durable against yanking toddlers. Also fits 2 adults and a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: BWhitley

customer_reviews.title: I wish the ties and pole loops on the interior were a bit more sturdy, but for the price you really can't beat ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this castle! I wish the ties and pole loops on the interior were a bit more sturdy, but for the price you really can't beat it. It was a little tricky to put together the first time, but with a second set of hands to help it went up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna

customer_reviews.title: The only negative thing is the supports are not fed through a fabric lining so they come out of place easily but for a 3yr old
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this for the price! The only negative thing is the supports are not fed through a fabric lining so they come out of place easily but for a 3yr old, it's great!!!
customer_reviews.author: TheartU

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Goes up in 2 mins but my husband ripped it the first day lol, don't try to pull across the floor while kids are inside
customer_reviews.author: Chanel Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck and the kids always love ...
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased these inexpensive tents (varying styles) for both of our children as well as nieces and nephews. Great bang for the buck and the kids always love them. Don't spend more money on such an item when typically kids honestly have just as much fun with a cardboard box. These fold up nice and small for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Damian517

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: The little prince for this castle absolutely loves it. I bought three of them for a 7, 5, and 2 year old. The 2 year old rolls around in his castle opening and closing the door and seeing how many cardboard bricks he can fit inside. The 7 yr old and her sister drag their castles all over the house and they are sturdy enough to handle the traveling even with dolls in them. Many hours of fun and imagination. Great Product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bigger on the inside! Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. It was a lot bigger than I thought it was going to be, I can actually fit in the castle with him. It's a bit of a challenge to put it up the first time but it's so easy to take down and store away. My son takes his books and pillows in it and can lay down in it (he's 2.5 years old).
customer_reviews.author: SMDesign

customer_reviews.title: It's okay for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I know that it's not the most expensive, but the quality is a bit lacking here. Don't expect it to last very long; a standard playdate will take this thing down.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very fragile
customer_reviews.text: Very thin and not durable. Had to get a replacement as the first one arrived with a hole in it. Then when we finally got the replacement, which was pretty quick, the kids fell on the side while playing and the poles ripped right thru the top.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S.

customer_reviews.title: Cute but very thin
customer_reviews.text: It’s fine for a gentle child but if you have a wild thing on your hands I don’t think it’s going to last very long. Easy to set up as long as you’re able to crawl inside.
customer_reviews.author: Jan M.

customer_reviews.title: Super cute but
customer_reviews.text: Really cute, but not super durable. One of the poles bent on this shortly after owning it.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Adorable!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 1 yr old grandson last Christmas. It’s one of his favorite little hideaways and he plays in it constantly. Totally adorable!
customer_reviews.author: Halycon

customer_reviews.title: Fun while it lasts
customer_reviews.text: Not great quality. Ripped by the entry on the first use. Toddler loves playing in it.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely cheap, lasted 4 mos, my son hardly even used it and there are rips and seams just falling apart everywhere. Not even in high traffic spots, random spots throughout, Sean’s are separating, very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Once I got it together it was fine. The included instructions are a little vague and ...
customer_reviews.text: Once I got it together it was fine. The included instructions are a little vague and don’t really do a good job of illustrating where the poles go. But overall it’s a good product and my nephew loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Derick

customer_reviews.title: ... for my son and the pink one for daughter great for imagination my son comes up with all kinds ...
customer_reviews.text: Prefect for my boy I have this one for my son and the pink one for daughter great for imagination my son comes up with all kinds of this to play with this. Very happy with this tent and super easy to set up and take down.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: FUN!
customer_reviews.text: My grandsons love this. They are 3 and 5, average size. They can get their pillows, small blanket and tablets, in there. It was easy to put together. It has a bag that you can store it in, when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not durable
customer_reviews.text: Hours of fun while it lasts.. kids will tear this apart, even by accident.
customer_reviews.author: A. Robles

customer_reviews.title: Super cute!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is super cute and my kids love it! The only thing is that the frame fits so tightly that it pulled 2 of the ties that hold it in place right off and its hard to set up. I wish the material was a little stretchy so that it had more give amd I could sew the ties back on. For the price it's still a good bit though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tent hard to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Kids played in it for a few minutes then moved onto something else. A mess to put together and take apart. You have to put the tent over your head to assemble the poles.
customer_reviews.author: RichR49

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: A lot bigger than I expected. I am 5'8" and my child and I easily both fit in it. And it stands up to myou rambunctious one year old. The only negative is the seams near the door rip easily. It doesn't effect the tent tho, we were still able to fill it with balls.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not best quality
customer_reviews.text: It’s an adorable tent for child. My son loves it. Although in the first week it already started ripping at the seam by door.
customer_reviews.author: Lillea90

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: Great item!!! My 4 yr old son loves his castle tent. It was easy to put together and is a good size. It doesn't take up too much floor space but it is tall enough for a child to stand up inside. The mesh windows are a good feature and the door has Velcro tabs they can use. The colors are a true red and dark gray. The online image made it appear a little washed out.
customer_reviews.author: Happy bride

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy construction
customer_reviews.text: After 3 minutes of use, one of the ties ripped from the seam and cant be reattached. Also all of the pockets that hold the support poles have separated allowing the poles to poke through. Bad design on the pockets to hold poles and flimsy ties to hold it together.... 1 star if that
customer_reviews.author: Robert Taliaferro

customer_reviews.title: Roomy, easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! My five year old loves it. Very roomy. And my five year old isnt small.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this!
customer_reviews.text: It is very well made and just as shown. My son LOVES his castle! A very good value at the price. We have hard floors and it is just that nylon tent material, we just put his tummy time mat under it from his baby days and it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: S and B

customer_reviews.title: No instructions
customer_reviews.text: This thing was awful to figure out. No directions included. Thank goodness for YouTube tutorials 😂
customer_reviews.author: Talia Jacques

customer_reviews.title: Great idea for imagination for playtime
customer_reviews.text: I got this the dragon book & the stuffed red dragon great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Jules in Ky

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up!! Fast Delivery Too!! My Grandson will have many happy hours playing Knight with his little castle or taking a much needed break with a book
customer_reviews.author: Sandra R

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made. Very thin nylon material. The loops for the poles are weak and not reinforced very well, it only took a week for the poles to break through. It's worthless at this point. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: MrsA

customer_reviews.title: Fun castle!
customer_reviews.text: Our son loves this castle. It was easy to put together. The only thing I would change about it is the height of the door--it would be great if it was slightly taller.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: but it feels like it's going to fall apart
customer_reviews.text: It's cute, but it feels like it's going to fall apart. Get the one from Ikea. It's much better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Click N' Play Knight Castle Design Play Tent .
customer_reviews.text: Big hit with grandson, likes this much better than the regular tent one; imagination runs wild! Lots of fun and pretty easy to set up and take down. Good service from seller.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Lover

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build
customer_reviews.text: Easy to build and fun for the 4yr old I bought this for. He no longer has to share, which he is excited about.
customer_reviews.author: SiMa

customer_reviews.title: Cute but cheap
customer_reviews.text: The poles that go into the bottom do not seem to stay in very well and ended up ripping the bottom of the floor already. Had only had it up for 2 hrs of use. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: MissyV

customer_reviews.title: my son loves it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son for Christmas and he was absolutely delighted. Pretty easy to put up just kinda sucks that it’s a little flimsy and the metal rods will at some point rip through some parts but not a big deal. Easy to put away too
customer_reviews.author: breanna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for boys!
customer_reviews.text: My 1.5 year old son loves this! I wish it didn't have the support bars in and would be able to just fold down and up quickly! The support bars are easy to use it is just an added step compares to other tents I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Cute,  but unstable
customer_reviews.text: It took a week for my 2 yr old to break.
customer_reviews.author: L. Llewellyn

customer_reviews.title: 😕
customer_reviews.text: Cute for 10 minutes until the ties break off and the ‘castle’ never stands again
customer_reviews.author: HBHBHB

customer_reviews.title: Okay product
customer_reviews.text: Great product,my son loved it. But breaks after a few months. Not too sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Annie💙

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is so cute for a little kid. My 18 month old son loves it. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: kids love it i love it easy to set up i ...
customer_reviews.text: kids love it i love it easy to set up i want an adult-size
customer_reviews.author: A. Lansky

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Forgot to leave under the tree so bday it is
customer_reviews.author: Diaperrash

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured!
customer_reviews.text: I am a little disappointed! Original picture showed a barrier at the very bottom so i bought this in mind to use as a sandbox..... thus when i got the item there was an open edge.... wont keep the sand i. Like i was hoping it would.
customer_reviews.author: D. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: My little guys loves it, and lives that there is a door flap.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Hackett

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and Weak
customer_reviews.text: The material is not very sturdy, and one of the posts is already bent. My daughter received this as a Christmas present and I have not been impressed with this so far.
customer_reviews.author: kdunlap18

customer_reviews.title: It was sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It was sturdy And easy to put together. The kids loved!
customer_reviews.author: Sally Green

customer_reviews.title: Love it. He's occupied which means I get a ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's first birthday. He loves it and will play inside of it for 30 minutes or more. That's huge for a toddler. Love it. He's occupied which means I get a bit of freedom.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Templeton

customer_reviews.title: They love it. They have their bed and keep all ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dogs. They love it. They have their bed and keep all their toys in it. Very cute and easy to put up, take down, and clean. Kids like it too.
customer_reviews.author: jvid85

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 2 year old son for Christmas and he can't stay out of it. It is easy to put together and fun to play hide and seek with!
customer_reviews.author: Keely Stricklin

customer_reviews.title: Door flap is crooked. Okay for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The door flap was sewn on crooked so the velcro straps at the end of it which are supposed to "lock" the door, do not line up.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie Arevalo

customer_reviews.title: unsafe
customer_reviews.text: Tent ripped to pieces and became unsafe to use within weeks. Had to throw it in the trash for safety reasons. Kids were so excited and then so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: C Vas

product_meta.title: Click N' Play Knight Castle Design Play Tent
product_meta.description: This Click n' Play Knight castle is an adorable gift for all boys. Fast and easy set up/breakdown with no tools required. The lightweight tent with a zipper carry bag is great for indoor or outdoor use. Its small size is easy to fit in compact home or kids room. The play tent can be folded flat for convenient storage when it is not in use.
feature_bullets: Light weight and easy to assemble Knight Castle design play tent
To be used in or out door. Easily folds and placed back in case for storage
Perforated Windows, lets the air in, helps keep the bugs out
Includes 4 Ground Pegs for better stability
Size: 40 inches diameter by 51 inches high. Material: 100% polyester fabric with steel frame. Adult Assembly Required

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
